results.title: To live and learn
results.brief_description: A film about London schools and school-children, showing the work of infant, junior and secondary schools. The film brings out the development of the children’s own personalities as well as showing teaching methods, and illustrates the wide variety of opportunities in London’s grammar and other secondary schools. Interviews with head teachers and parents are included.

results.title: To Live and die in L.A.
results.creator_credit: New Century, SLM, Irving H. Levin and William Friedkin
results.brief_description: This action packed movie centres around two LA cops, one who eventually gets killed in the line of duty and the other who seeks his partner’s revenge. Stars William L. Petersen, Willem Dafoe, John Pankow, Debra Feuer, John Turturro, Dean Stockwell and Robert Downey Snr. Based on the novel by Gerald Petievich.

results.title: To live = Lifetimes
results.creator_credit: ERA International (HK), Shanghai Film Studios, Fu-Sheng Chiu and Zhang Yimou
results.brief_description: To Live (or Lifetimes) is an extraordinary film which takes us through the major events in 20th century Chinese history. Gong Li and Ge You play a couple who struggle to survive in the midst of the tumultuous events that unfold in their lifetimes. With great power and subtlety Zhang Yimou places his characters in the fringes of the civil war, the great leap forward and the cultural revolution. Through their struggle to survive we experience the devastating effects of these historical events. Winner of the “Grand Jury Prize” and “Best Actor” in Cannes 1994, To Live is a moving tribute to all people who struggle to survive against the powerful arms of fate and history. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: To learn day by day
results.creator_credit: Video Media Production and Alex Jaye
results.brief_description: Offers advice to child care providers on appropriate strategies to facilitate the learning of basic concepts such as big, round, etc. as well as number games and colours. Provides a strategy which involves starting with concepts and moving on to comparisons. Appropriate for professional Development and personal development (Home Economics) at VCE level.

results.title: To know the Hurons
results.creator_credit: Haverand Productions, ONF | NFB and George Appleby
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates a new style of excavation used for archaeological work at the Draper site north of Toronto where there are remains of a large Huron village. With financial support from Transport Canada and the Archaeological Surveys of Canada, all the findings were fed into a computer, resulting in far more comprehensive information than would have been the case under the old system. Voice and narration: William D. Finlayson. (Award: Verona.)

results.title: To Kill a mockingbird [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Pakula-Mulligan Productions, Brentwood, Alan Pakula and Robert Mulligan
results.brief_description: This is an atmospheric adaptation by Horton Foote of Harper Lee’s sensitive novel of the same name. Told in retrospect, it successfully tackles the themes of racial prejudice in America’s Deep South with the gradual maturing of compassion and social insight in children. Gregory Peck plays Atticus Finch, the soft spoken, small town, Alabama lawyer given the responsibility of defending Tom Robinson, a black man unjustly accused of rape. This is perfectly balanced with Finch as the family man who has the added responsibility of bringing up two motherless and inquisitive children, played by Mary Badham and Phillip Afford. (Awards: Winner of three Academy Awards, including Best Actor for Gregory Peck)

results.title: To kill a child
results.brief_description: Road safety film. Introduces, with apparent casualness, a young couple about to set off on a motoring trip and a little girl at play. Happy and relaxed, they are planning to make the most of a fine day. A few minutes later the child is dead and the holiday makers numb with shock. The very lack of sensationalism makes the events seem real, leaving one with a sense of lives devastated without warning by pointless, avoidable tragedy.

results.title: To keep the faith
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Pat Kavanagh
results.brief_description: A religious documentary with commentary by Francis James. Illustrates the enormous cultural influence of the orthodox church over eastern Europe. Raises the issue of the cultural flux generations of immigrant families find themselves in.

results.title: To help them learn (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines the role of audiovisual media in modern education. Encourages the use of media for captivating children’s attention, offering a variety of approaches to learning, and stimulating students through meaningful experiences.
